question: The report _____ (complete) by the team before the deadline.
description: 'Was completed' uses the past passive form, indicating that the action of completing occurred before a specific point in the past.

question: The proposal _____ (submit) to the board by John last week.
description: 'Was submitted' indicates a completed action in the past, emphasizing that John took the action last week.

question: The documents need _____ (sign) by the manager.
description: 'To be signed' is the correct infinitive form, indicating that the documents require the managerâ€™s action.

question: The new policy _____ (introduce) at the last meeting.
description: 'Was introduced' denotes that the introduction of the policy occurred at a specific time in the past.

question: This software _____ (develop) to improve efficiency.
description: 'Has been developed' indicates a recent action with relevance to the present, showing the ongoing impact of the development.

question: Mistakes _____ (make) in the initial phase of the project.
description: 'Were made' signifies that mistakes occurred at a specific time in the past and are now part of the project history.

question: The project manager expects the task _____ (complete) by tomorrow.
description: 'To be completed' is the correct form indicating expectation of future completion.

question: She got her car _____ (repair) yesterday.
description: 'Repaired' follows the structure of 'get' + past participle, indicating that she arranged for the car to be repaired.

question: The homework _____ (not do) by the students on time.
description: 'Was not done' emphasizes that the action did not occur in the past as expected.

question: The cake _____ (make) by a famous chef for the event.
description: 'Was made' indicates that the cake's creation took place in the past and highlights the chef's role.

question: All reports _____ (review) before the meeting started.
description: 'Were reviewed' shows that the reviews were completed before another past action (the meeting).

question: The meeting will _____ (hold) next Monday.
description: 'Be held' is the correct passive form indicating the future event of the meeting.

question: The new regulations should _____ (implement) by the end of the month.
description: 'Be implemented' conveys a necessity for future action regarding the regulations.

question: The homework is _____ (complete) by the students at home.
description: 'Completed' shows the passive structure in the present tense, indicating that students are responsible for completing the homework.

question: The book _____ (write) by an award-winning author.
description: 'Was written' indicates that the action of writing occurred in the past and is relevant to the book's authorship.

question: The project got _____ (approve) after several revisions.
description: 'Approved' follows the structure of 'get' + past participle, indicating the project's successful approval.

question: The presentation _____ (not prepare) by the students, leading to confusion.
description: 'Was not prepared' indicates a past action that did not occur, which affected the outcome.

question: The equipment should _____ (handle) with care.
description: 'Be handled' expresses a recommendation for the correct method of dealing with the equipment.

question: The document needs _____ (sign) by all parties involved.
description: 'To be signed' indicates the required action needed for completion of the document.

question: The issue will _____ (discuss) in the next meeting.
description: 'Be discussed' shows future passive construction indicating what will occur in the meeting.

question: The tasks were _____ (assign) to various teams last week.
description: 'Assigned' signifies that the action was completed in the past, distributing tasks to teams.

question: He will get his work _____ (review) by the supervisor.
description: 'Reviewed' follows the 'get' + past participle structure, indicating his work will undergo evaluation.

question: This project must _____ (complete) by the end of the month.
description: 'Be completed' expresses necessity, emphasizing the requirement for timely completion.

question: The emails need _____ (send) out before noon.
description: 'To be sent' indicates the required action for the emails, highlighting the urgency.

question: The report was _____ (write) by the new intern last week.
description: 'Written' indicates that the report was produced by the intern in the past.
